summary: This is an amended notification letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to an attorney representing an identified victim of Jeffrey Epstein. It corrects prior information and outlines the terms of Epstein's non-prosecution agreement, including the appointment of a special attorney for victims and Epstein's waiver of certain defenses in civil suits under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case who pleaded guilty to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. The letter details the conditions of the federal non-prosecution agreement following his state plea.

persons.name: Robert Josefsberg
persons.context: A highly-respected attorney selected by an independent Special Master to represent victims in civil litigation against Jeffrey Epstein. His services are to be paid for by Epstein.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's attorney. The letter states he should be contacted if the victim has selected other counsel and decides to pursue a claim.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the notification letter.

connections.description: Epstein is obligated to pay the fees and costs of Josefsberg, who was appointed as the attorney representative for victims in civil litigation against Epstein.
Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney in the letter.
Josefsberg, as victims' representative, and Goldberger, as Epstein's attorney, are the designated points of contact for civil litigation matters.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County Circuit Court to felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment, followed by 6 months' imprisonment, then 12 months of community control.

events.title: Amended Victim Notification Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends this amended notification letter to correct inaccuracies in a prior July 10, 2008, letter and formally outline the conditions of the federal non-prosecution agreement to a victim's attorney.

events.title: Appointment of Special Master and Attorney Representative
events.description: An independent Special Master was assigned to select an attorney to represent victims in civil litigation against Epstein, resulting in the selection of Robert Josefsberg.

locations: 15th Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges on June 30, 2008, and received an 18-month incarceration sentence followed by 12 months of community control.
The federal government agreed to defer prosecution based on this state plea, subject to conditions including the appointment of a victims' attorney representative paid for by Epstein.
Epstein agreed not to contest liability or damages up to an agreed amount in any civil suit filed under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255, though this is not an admission of liability.
The letter references ongoing litigation ('In re Jane Does I and 2') regarding the disclosure of the full agreement between the United States and Epstein.
The document is an amended notification, indicating prior communications with victims contained inaccuracies that needed correction.
